context_bundle.summary: Software and Data Integrity Failures (OWASP A08:2021): Unverified updates, CI/CD pipeline compromises, insecure deserialization. Fix: use digital signatures for updates, verify dependencies from trusted repos, implement CI/CD security controls (signed commits, protected branches), review code changes, use integrity checks.

onboarding.quick_start: Integrity defense: 1) Sign all software releases with GPG/Sigstore, 2) Verify package checksums/signatures before install, 3) Require signed commits in CI/CD, 4) Use branch protection rules, 5) Implement SLSA framework for supply chain security.
common_patterns: Package integrity: npm ci (uses package-lock.json for reproducible builds)
SLSA Level 2: Hosted build service, signed provenance
Branch protection: Require PR reviews, status checks before merge

known_errors.cause: Developer typo when installing package, no lockfile verification
known_errors.solution: Use npm ci instead of npm install, verify package names before adding
known_errors.prevention: Lockfile commit requirement, package allowlist for critical deps

known_errors.error: CI/CD pipeline compromised to inject malicious code
known_errors.cause: Insufficient access controls on build system
known_errors.solution: Audit CI/CD access, rotate credentials, implement signed builds
known_errors.prevention: Least privilege for CI/CD, ephemeral build environments, signed provenance
